nodes.name: onlyTokenOwner
getTokenValue

params.value: - The amount of value in the coin we need to send

getOpportunityBalance(bytes32,bytes32).return: The total value of the Opportunity (capital + yield)

params.amountToWithdraw: - The amount we're trying to check if we have yield on if we withdrew

getOpportunityYield(bytes32,bytes32,uint.return: The amount of yield this opportunity has if we withdraw a certain value

getPricePerShare(bytes32,uint256).return: The price per share scaled by ON_CHAIN_PRECISION   /// TODO:    This function is common across all Opportunities/Portfolios, stop repeating it

getTokenValue(bytes32,bytes32).return: Value of the token and price per share used to calculate it   /// TODO:     This function is common across all Opportunities, stop repeating it TOOD:     Stop returning the price per share used   /// Already checked isExistingOpportunityToken when this gets called (from here and OpportunityManager)

params.realizedYield: - The realized yield of this portfolio
params.unrealizedYield: - The unrealized yield of the portfolio
params.withdrawnYield: - The withdrawn yield of this portfolio

getTotalYield(uint256,uint256,uint256).return: The total yield   /// TODO:    This function is common across all Opportunities/Portfolios, stop repeating it

params.portfolioId: - The portfolio id   /// return   The yield per share scaled by ON_CHAIN_PRECISION

onlyTokenOwner(bytes32,address,address).details: This function exists so we can support paying for user transactions.

params.msgSender: - The msg.sender to the function in PortfolioManager
params.origCaller: - The address that signed the transaction that went through Payer
params.tokenId: - The unique id of the position in question

updateYield(bytes32,uint256).details: Yield is always greater than zero when this is called

params.yield: - The yield withdrawn in   /// TODO:    This function is common, DRY

calculatePayableAmount(address,uint256).notice: Decides how much value() we need to send to our OpportunityManager function          that accepts ETH and ERC20's. It does this by checking if the          coin in question is an ERC20 or not.

getOpportunityBalance(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Get the total value of a generic Opportunity

getOpportunityYield(bytes32,bytes32,uint.notice: Calculate how much yield a generic Opportunity has made

getPortfolioUnrealizedYield(bytes32).notice: Sums the unrealized yield from all the opportunities in this portfolio

getPricePerShare(bytes32,uint256).notice: Calculates the current price per share

getTotalYield(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Calculates the total yield when considering all factors

getTotalYieldPerShare(bytes32,uint256).notice: Calculates the current yield per share

onlyTokenOwner(bytes32,address,address).notice: Checks that if the msg.sender == our Payer contract and then the          original caller == the true owner. We can do this since we trust          Payer (ours). Else, msg.sender must be the true owner of the token.

updateYield(bytes32,uint256).notice: Update the yield after withdrawing it
